Mannheimer Swartling has comprehensive expertise in the regulatory landscape for digital products and services. Our lawyers closely follow the rapid developments in this area and work daily with regulatory advice, transactions and supervisory matters.

The EU has recently adopted a number of new directives and regulations in areas such as product safety, cybersecurity, sharing and management of data, resilience, continuity management, digital platforms and the development and use of AI. Some of these regulations affect all companies, regardless of industry or size. Other regulations affect specific industries or authorities.

In the rapidly changing landscape of digital products and services, we support our clients with everything from strategic advice and regulatory compliance to executing the most complex and strategically important transactions and projects. In the area of Digital Compliance, we ensure seamless collaboration and full integration of legal competences and industry knowledge to create commercial, value-creating and innovative solutions for our clients in areas such as cyber and product security, privacy and consumer protection, resilience, security legislation and digital markets and access to and use of data.

A number of the firm’s specialists collaborate in the field of Digital Compliance to tailor the best possible advice to each client and matter, and to ensure that the firm is always up to date with the latest developments in the field.

 

A selection of our services

  • Compliance programmes – designing and implementing global, regional or local compliance programmes and reviewing and auditing existing programmes
  • Assisting the firm’s clients in investigations and proceedings before Swedish and European supervisory authorities
  • Representing the firm’s clients in disputes against regulatory authorities in administrative courts
  • Strategic advice on outsourcing and product development of cloud services and connected devices
  • Drafting and negotiation of agreements in the area of Digital Compliance
  • Tailored and forward-looking regulatory monitoring taking into account key client issues
  • Advice and specialised work in connection with transactions involving operations or products which are subject to the relevant regulations
  • Assisting in connection with incidents and data breaches, e.g. notifications to supervisory authorities and subsequent investigations
